cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (155 km) south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward Haiti and eastern Cuba, then forecast to turn NNW across the Bahamas and approach the Florida east-central coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Florida’s east-central coast (closest pass over/near Canaveral area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Turks and Caicos, the Cuban province of Camaguey, and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Haiti, eastern Cuba (Guantanamo through Las Tunas), and the south-eastern and central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Bahamas chain, eastern Cuba, Hispaniola, and the U.S. Southeast coast from south-east Florida through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (34–50 kt probabilities 59%/26%). Hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks close to the coast Thursday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–5 ft or higher surge along the Cape Canaveral barrier shoreline with large battering waves if Matthew parallels the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall possible in east-central Florida with locally higher amounts under rainbands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous surf/rip currents; possible port closure and navigation restrictions due to high seas and winds.
